title: Hank: Five Years from the Brink
description: From Joe Berlinger, director of the "Paradise Lost" trilogy, comes this documentary about controversial former U.S. Treasury Secretary Henry Paulson.

title: Hannah: Buddhism's Untold Journey
description: This documentary tells the story of Hannah Nydahl, a free-spirited Dane whose personal journey brought Tibetan Buddhism to the West in the 1960s.

title: Happy
description: Happy takes viewers on a journey from the swamps of Louisiana to the slums of Kolkata in search of what really makes people happy.
actors: Marci Shimoff, Gregory Berns, Richard Davidson, Ed Diener

title: Hard Time
description: Go behind bars at a maximum-security prison in this gritty documentary series chronicling a year in the life of the facility's wardens and inmates.

title: Hardliners
description: Veteran longline fishermen risk their lives in the treacherous waters off Australia's east coast to catch big tuna and swordfish for upscale markets.

title: Harold and Lillian: A Hollywood Love Story
description: Storyboard artist Harold Michelson and his film researcher wife, Lillian, recall the influence they had on 60 years of Hollywood's biggest hits.
actors: Harold Michelson, Lillian Michelson, Mel Brooks, Francis Ford Coppola

title: Harry Benson: Shoot First
description: This film chronicles the career of photographer Harry Benson, who earned global renown with his candid shots of the Beatles and other celebrities.

title: He Named Me Malala
description: This documentary tells the story of a teenage Pakistani girl shot for her advocacy of women's education, her survival, and her continued efforts.

title: Heroin(e)
description: This Oscar-nominated film follows three women -- a fire chief, a judge and a street missionary -- battling West Virginia's devastating opioid epidemic.

title: Hired Gun
description: Session musicians get their time in the spotlight with interviews, concert footage and behind-the-scenes stories about their brushes with greatness.
actors: Alice Cooper, Rudy Sarzo, David Foster, Steve Vai

title: Hiroshima: The Real History
description: This detailed examination of the 1945 Hiroshima bombing includes the prelude to and aftermath of history's controversial first use of atomic weapons.

title: Hitler of the Andes
description: Declassified FBI documents trace an 11-year investigation of rumors that Hitler survived Germany's defeat in 1945, escaping via U-boat to Argentina.

title: Holy Hell
description: An ex-member charts his path from idealism to disenchantment in a California cult when alarming revelations about the group's leader come to light.

title: Hot Girls Wanted
description: This 2015 Sundance Film Festival breakout documentary from producer Rashida Jones spotlights the "amateur" porn industry and the women it exploits.

title: Hot Girls Wanted: Turned On
description: Personal stories reveal how the intersection of sex, technology and intimate relationships is rewiring us in fundamental ways.

title: Hot Sugar's Cold World
description: Cameras follow musical innovator Nick Koenig, aka Hot Sugar, as he captures the noises of Paris and transforms them into one-of-a-kind soundscapes.

title: House of Z
description: Featuring archival footage and exclusive interviews, this documentary looks at the rise, fall and comeback of charismatic fashion designer Zac Posen.

title: How the Beatles Changed the World
description: Interviews and rare archival footage illuminate how the Beatles' influence over music and culture continues to be felt around the world.
actors: George Harrison, John Lennon, Ringo Starr, Paul McCartney

title: How to Stage a Coup
description: Explore how Caesar, Napoleon, Mussolini, Hitler and modern-day dictators consolidated their considerable power through bold and brazen coups.

title: How to Win the US Presidency
description: This whimsical look at rough-and-tumble American politics examines the influence of money, religion and even ancient Rome on presidential campaigns.

title: Humpback Whales
description: After near extinction 50 years ago, humpback whales are thriving. Their recovery is captured in this documentary filmed in Alaska, Hawaii and Tonga.
